line_1: HOW sweet to recall the sweet moments of joy!
line_2: 'Tis this, and this only can Absence employ,

line_1: 'Tis this, and this only can Absence employ,
line_2: HOW sweet to recall the sweet moments of joy!

line_1: Can ease my fond heart, and beguile my soft pain,
line_2: Till I see with delight my dear charmer again.

line_1: Till I see with delight my dear charmer again.
line_2: Can ease my fond heart, and beguile my soft pain,

line_1: Ah! who ever knew such full transports as I,
line_2: While with her, the swift minutes unheeded pass'd by,

line_1: While with her, the swift minutes unheeded pass'd by,
line_2: Ah! who ever knew such full transports as I,

line_1: Alas! with the sweet recollection I burn,
line_2: Bring back your delights, ye dear moments, return!

line_1: Bring back your delights, ye dear moments, return!
line_2: Alas! with the sweet recollection I burn,

line_1: Ah me! what delights in my bosom would rise
line_2: While with eager attention I've hung on her eyes,

line_1: While with eager attention I've hung on her eyes,
line_2: Ah me! what delights in my bosom would rise

line_1: And watch'd the kind beams of Compassion and Love,
line_2: While she pitied my passion, and seem'd to approve;

line_1: While she pitied my passion, and seem'd to approve;
line_2: And watch'd the kind beams of Compassion and Love,

line_1: Ah me! with what raptur'd attention I've hung,
line_2: To catch the sweet accents that flow'd from her tongue,

line_1: To catch the sweet accents that flow'd from her tongue,
line_2: Ah me! with what raptur'd attention I've hung,

line_1: When tenderness bade the dear maiden impart
line_2: The pleasing sensations that glow'd in her heart.

line_1: The pleasing sensations that glow'd in her heart.
line_2: When tenderness bade the dear maiden impart

line_1: O how does my Fair one consume the long day?
line_2: Is the Charmer quite easy while I am away?

line_1: Is the Charmer quite easy while I am away?
line_2: O how does my Fair one consume the long day?

line_1: Indeed if our thoughts like our hearts should agree,
line_2: The dear lovely maiden is thinking on me:

line_1: The dear lovely maiden is thinking on me:
line_2: Indeed if our thoughts like our hearts should agree,

line_1: Ah! did she but think with such fondness as I,
line_2: How much would she grieve, and how oft would she sigh!

line_1: How much would she grieve, and how oft would she sigh!
line_2: Ah! did she but think with such fondness as I,

line_1: Yet with so much fond Love may her bosom ne'er burn,
line_2: If she sighs as I sigh, if she mourns as I mourn.

line_1: If she sighs as I sigh, if she mourns as I mourn.
line_2: Yet with so much fond Love may her bosom ne'er burn,

line_1: But why do I wander? why sigh thus alone?
line_2: Alas! 'tis the loss of my Fair that I moan.

line_1: Alas! 'tis the loss of my Fair that I moan.
line_2: But why do I wander? why sigh thus alone?

line_1: Why thus every hour does my sorrow increase?
line_2: Alas! it is Absence that ruins my peace.

line_1: Alas! it is Absence that ruins my peace.
line_2: Why thus every hour does my sorrow increase?

line_1: Why swells my sad bosom with fear and with grief?
line_2: Ah! nought but her presence can bring me relief.

line_1: Ah! nought but her presence can bring me relief.
line_2: Why swells my sad bosom with fear and with grief?

line_1: Why thus down my cheek trickles fast the big tear?
line_2: Alas! can I help it? — my Fair is not here.

line_1: Alas! can I help it? — my Fair is not here.
line_2: Why thus down my cheek trickles fast the big tear?

line_1: Till I nourish'd this passion I all unconcern'd
line_2: Saw Peace my companion wherever I turn'd,

line_1: Saw Peace my companion wherever I turn'd,
line_2: Till I nourish'd this passion I all unconcern'd

line_1: Till now with my heart all at ease I could rest,
line_2: And a sigh was a stranger unknown to my breast.

line_1: And a sigh was a stranger unknown to my breast.
line_2: Till now with my heart all at ease I could rest,

line_1: What then is this Love? and why do I endure
line_2: These griefs in my mind, nor endeavour to cure?

line_1: These griefs in my mind, nor endeavour to cure?
line_2: What then is this Love? and why do I endure

line_1: When thus my fond heart is o'erwhelm'd with Despair,
line_2: And I know no delight when away from my Fair?

line_1: And I know no delight when away from my Fair?
line_2: When thus my fond heart is o'erwhelm'd with Despair,

line_1: Yet, Colin, these pains, spite of all thou hast said,
line_2: By one hour of her presence are far over-paid,

line_1: By one hour of her presence are far over-paid,
line_2: Yet, Colin, these pains, spite of all thou hast said,

line_1: These sorrows from Absence which now you deplore,
line_2: Then vanish, are lost, and are thought of no more.

line_1: Then vanish, are lost, and are thought of no more.
line_2: These sorrows from Absence which now you deplore,

line_1: Recall those rash words, and forbear to complain,
line_2: Since the next tender meeting rewards all your pain,

line_1: Since the next tender meeting rewards all your pain,
line_2: Recall those rash words, and forbear to complain,

line_1: Let sweet Expectation then lessen your care,
line_2: Let Hope soften Absence, and keep off Despair.

line_1: Let Hope soften Absence, and keep off Despair.
line_2: Let sweet Expectation then lessen your care,

line_1: Sure, sure those dear pleasures once more will return;
line_2: How long in this Absence distrest must I mourn?

line_1: How long in this Absence distrest must I mourn?
line_2: Sure, sure those dear pleasures once more will return;

line_1: How long must I wish, while my lot I deplore,
line_2: That dear angel-face! — could I see it once more!

line_1: That dear angel-face! — could I see it once more!
line_2: How long must I wish, while my lot I deplore,

line_1: That dear angel-voice! — Time, how swift didst thou seem,
line_2: While I listen'd enchanted as Love was her theme!

line_1: While I listen'd enchanted as Love was her theme!
line_2: That dear angel-voice! — Time, how swift didst thou seem,

line_1: O come those dear hours! and to soothe my fond pain
line_2: Love again be her theme, and I listen again!

line_1: Love again be her theme, and I listen again!
line_2: O come those dear hours! and to soothe my fond pain

line_1: How dull and how slow do the moments retreat!
line_2: Time was when they flew: — now there's lead on their feet.

line_1: Time was when they flew: — now there's lead on their feet.
line_2: How dull and how slow do the moments retreat!

line_1: Ye Loiterers, be gone; why so long do ye stay?
line_2: Ye fly when I'm with her, ye creep when away.

line_1: Ye fly when I'm with her, ye creep when away.
line_2: Ye Loiterers, be gone; why so long do ye stay?

line_1: Ah! Colin, how foolish Time's progress to blame,
line_2: His paces are equal, his motions the same;

line_1: His paces are equal, his motions the same;
line_2: Ah! Colin, how foolish Time's progress to blame,

line_1: 'Twas the joy of her Presence made Time appear fleet,
line_2: 'Tis the pain of her Absence adds lead to his feet.

line_1: 'Tis the pain of her Absence adds lead to his feet.
line_2: 'Twas the joy of her Presence made Time appear fleet,

line_1: MARK, mortals! mark with awe profound
line_2: What solemn stillness reigns around;

line_1: What solemn stillness reigns around;
line_2: MARK, mortals! mark with awe profound

line_1: Know then, tho' strange it may appear,
line_2: Spirits — why start? — inhabit here.

line_1: Spirits — why start? — inhabit here.
line_2: Know then, tho' strange it may appear,

line_1: Whene'er we leave the circled green,
line_2: We Fairies chuse this shady scene;

line_1: We Fairies chuse this shady scene;
line_2: Whene'er we leave the circled green,

line_1: Tho' mortal hands have form'd these bowers,
line_2: Yet is the sweet retirement ours.

line_1: Yet is the sweet retirement ours.
line_2: Tho' mortal hands have form'd these bowers,

line_1: For here, when as the pallid moon
line_2: "Riding near her highest noon,"

line_1: "Riding near her highest noon,"
line_2: For here, when as the pallid moon

line_1: Edging the clouds with silver white,
line_2: Darts thro' these shades a checquer'd light,

line_1: Darts thro' these shades a checquer'd light,
line_2: Edging the clouds with silver white,

line_1: Here, when we cease our airy sport,
line_2: We range our bands and fix our court.

line_1: We range our bands and fix our court.
line_2: Here, when we cease our airy sport,

line_1: My royal throne, exalted high,
line_2: Unseen by feeble, mortal eye,

line_1: Unseen by feeble, mortal eye,
line_2: My royal throne, exalted high,

line_1: Tho' spangled with ten thousand dews,
line_2: Tho' colour'd with ten thousand hues,

line_1: Tho' colour'd with ten thousand hues,
line_2: Tho' spangled with ten thousand dews,

line_1: (Approach not with unhallow'd hands)
line_2: Beneath yon tall Laburnum stands.

line_1: Beneath yon tall Laburnum stands.
line_2: (Approach not with unhallow'd hands)

line_1: Then enter here with guiltless mind,
line_2: Spurn each vile passion far behind.

line_1: Spurn each vile passion far behind.
line_2: Then enter here with guiltless mind,

line_1: Hence Envy with her pining train,
line_2: And venal love of sordid gain;

line_1: And venal love of sordid gain;
line_2: Hence Envy with her pining train,

line_1: Hence Malice, rankling at the heart,
line_2: And dire Revenge with poison'd dart;

line_1: And dire Revenge with poison'd dart;
line_2: Hence Malice, rankling at the heart,

line_1: Hence Lust with sly uneasy mien,
line_2: That thro' the twilight creeps unseen;

line_1: That thro' the twilight creeps unseen;
line_2: Hence Lust with sly uneasy mien,

line_1: Hence Vice; avoid this arching grove,
line_2: Pollution follows where you move;

line_1: Pollution follows where you move;
line_2: Hence Vice; avoid this arching grove,

line_1: Hence; nor near the spot be found,
line_2: "Hence! avaunt! — 'tis holy ground!"
